name: Sherlock Holmes Vocabulary
description: English vocabulary words learned from Sherlock Holmes stories
context: Learn English words that readers commonly encounter while reading Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes stories. These words help build vocabulary through Victorian mystery context.

words.meaning: the process of reaching logical conclusions from given facts
having sharp intelligence; clever and perceptive
showing great attention to detail; very careful
done according to a systematic plan; orderly
exceptionally good or great; remarkable
strange or odd; unusual
relating to basic principles; simple
involving many carefully arranged parts; detailed
giving the impression of evil or harm
famous for something bad; having a bad reputation
having skill in achieving goals by deceit
characterized by malice; intending harm
clever, original, and inventive
inspiring fear or respect through power or skill
belonging to or characteristic of the devil; evil
completely baffling; very puzzling
difficult to understand or explain; strange
a means of solving a problem or dealing with a situation
a surprising disclosure of something previously unknown
the action of investigating; systematic inquiry
